title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.24 | 18-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: My dear Krishna, Your Lordship has protected us from a poison cake, from a great fire, from cannibals, from the vicious assembly, from sufferings during our exile in the world.
segments.summary: Queen Kunti's prayer listing the dangers Krishna saved her and her sons from is introduced.

segments.key_quote: This is the reciprocation of the Lord with his devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker compares Devaki's and Kunti's situations, highlighting the constant dangers Kunti faced and Krishna's protection, emphasizing the Lord's reciprocation with devotees.

segments.key_quote: My devotee will never be vanquished.
segments.summary: The speaker quotes Krishna's promise in the Bhagavad Gita that His devotees will never be vanquished, illustrating this with the Pandavas' survival despite numerous attempts on their lives.

segments.key_quote: What has Duryodhana done? He has arranged that secretly Bhima be thrown into a river.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of Duryodhana's attempt to poison Bhima and throw him into the river, highlighting Duryodhana's envy and Bhima's vulnerability.

segments.key_quote: Bhima was given special medication to increase his strength to that of 10,000 elephants so Bhima became very very very strong
segments.summary: The speaker continues the story of Bhima, explaining how he was saved by the Nagas, given immense strength, and eventually returned to his family.

segments.key_quote: And Bhima in this way was actually saved from being killed by Krishna's arrangement. It was Krishna's arrangement.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the reaction of Kunti and Duryodhana to Bhima's reappearance, emphasizing that Bhima's survival was due to Krishna's arrangement.

segments.key_quote: So Yudhishthira through Vidura's help, he dug a tunnel as soon as they went into the palace.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of the house of shellac, Vidura's warning, and the Pandavas' escape through a tunnel, highlighting their intelligence and Krishna's protection.

segments.key_quote: But Draupadi was supplied with unlimited length of sari.
segments.summary: The speaker recounts the attempted disrobing of Draupadi and Krishna's miraculous intervention, as well as Bhima's fight with the demon Hidimba.

segments.key_quote: But Krishna, he protected Arjuna and the Pandavas.
segments.summary: The speaker briefly mentions the Kurukshetra battle and Ashwathama's Brahmastra, emphasizing Krishna's constant protection of the Pandavas.
